text: Octopuses have three hearts and blue blood.
A group of flamingos is called a "flamboyance."
Elephants can "hear" through their feet by detecting ground vibrations.
Cows have best friends and get stressed when they are separated.
The heart of a shrimp is located in its head.
Sloths can hold their breath for up to 40 minutes.
Starfish can regenerate lost arms and sometimes even grow a whole new body.
Giraffes only need 5 to 30 minutes of sleep per day.
Penguins propose to their mates with pebbles.
Some fish can recognize themselves in a mirror.
A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus.
Neutron stars are so dense that a sugar-cube-sized amount of their material would weigh as much as Mount Everest.
The Sun is about 4.6 billion years old and halfway through its lifespan.
There are more stars in the universe than grains of sand on Earth.
Saturn could float in water because it’s mostly made of gas.
The Moon is slowly drifting away from Earth by about 1.5 inches per year.
Jupiter has 95 known moons (as of 2023).
Mars appears red because of iron oxide (rust) on its surface.
A single teaspoon of a black hole's material would weigh billions of tons.
The largest volcano in the solar system is on Mars. It’s called Olympus Mons.
Cleopatra lived closer in time to the moon landing than to the construction of the Great Pyramid.
The Eiffel Tower can grow up to 6 inches taller in summer due to heat expansion.
The shortest war in history lasted only 38 to 45 minutes (Anglo-Zanzibar War).
Napoleon Bonaparte was once attacked by a horde of bunnies.
The Great Fire of London in 1666 destroyed 80% of the city but only six people were recorded as dying.
Abraham Lincoln is in the Wrestling Hall of Fame for winning almost 300 matches.
Ancient Egyptians used honey as an antibiotic and a wound dressing.
Vikings used the bones of slain animals to strengthen their weapons.
Leonardo da Vinci was ambidextrous and could draw with one hand while writing with the other.
The ancient Romans used powdered mouse brains as toothpaste.
Bananas are berries; but strawberries are not.
Water can boil and freeze at the same time (called the triple point).
Lightning strikes Earth about 8 million times per day.
Humans share about 60% of their DNA with bananas.
Hot water can freeze faster than cold water under certain conditions (the Mpemba effect).
The human stomach gets a new lining every 3-4 days to prevent it from digesting itself.
Glass is actually a very slow-moving liquid; not a true solid.
The strongest material in the human body is tooth enamel.
If you stretched out all the DNA in your body; it would reach the sun and back about 600 times.
The average human body has enough fat to make seven bars of soap.
Canada has more lakes than the rest of the world combined.
Mount Everest is still growing by about 4 millimeters each year.
Antarctica is the largest desert in the world.
There’s a town in Norway called Hell; and it freezes over every winter.
The Amazon rainforest produces 20% of the world’s oxygen.
Russia spans 11 time zones.
Iceland doesn’t have any mosquitoes.
The Sahara Desert can reach temperatures of up to 58 degrees celcius.
The Dead Sea is so salty that people can easily float on its surface.
The Great Wall of China is not visible from space with the naked eye.
The first computer virus was created in 1986 and was called "Brain."
The first email was sent in 1971.
Apple’s first logo featured Sir Isaac Newton sitting under a tree.
The first 1 gigabyte hard drive; introduced in 1980; weighed over 500 pounds.
Bluetooth technology is named after a 10th-century Danish king; Harald "Bluetooth" Gormsson.
The "@" symbol was first used in email addresses in 1977.
The first website ever created is still online (info.cern.ch).
Amazon originally only sold books when it launched in 1995.
Nokia started as a paper mill company in 1865.
The world's first text message said "Merry Christmas."
Walt Disney was afraid of mice.
The voice of Mickey Mouse and the voice of Minnie Mouse were married in real life.
Barbie's full name is Barbara Millicent Roberts.
The first feature-length animated movie was "Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs."
The "Happy Birthday" song is still under copyright in some places.
The first YouTube video was titled "Me at the zoo."
The Wizard of Oz’s ruby slippers were originally silver in the book.
Elvis Presley only won three Grammys in his entire career.
The longest-running TV show in history is "The Simpsons."
Superman first appeared in 1938 in Action Comics 1.
The Olympic Games were originally held in ancient Greece in 776 BC.
A baseball has exactly 108 stitches.
The first Super Bowl was held in 1967.
Golf is the only sport played on the Moon (by astronaut Alan Shepard).
The Stanley Cup is the oldest professional sports trophy in North America.
The fastest goal in soccer history was scored just 2.1 seconds after kickoff.
Basketball was invented by a Canadian called Dr. James Naismith.
Table tennis is the fastest ball sport in the world.
The first Wimbledon tournament was held in 1877.
The longest tennis match lasted 11 hours and 5 minutes over three days.
Your nose can remember 50000 different scents.
Humans have around 206 bones as adults but start with 270 as babies.
Your fingernails grow faster on your dominant hand.
Your skin replaces itself every 27 days.
The average human heart beats about 100000 times per day.
You produce about 25000 quarts of saliva in a lifetime—enough to fill two swimming pools.
The tongue is the only muscle in the body that is attached at just one end.
Humans are the only animals that blush.
The human brain generates enough electricity to power a lightbulb.
You can’t tickle yourself because your brain predicts the sensation.
The dot over the lowercase "i" and "j" is called a "tittle."
Wombat poop is cube-shaped.
The inventor of the Pringles can is buried in one.
The average cloud weighs about 1.1 million pounds.
A group of porcupines is called a "prickle."
Scotland’s national animal is the unicorn.
There’s a basketball court in the U.S. Supreme Court building.
The longest hiccuping spree lasted 68 years.
The shortest war lasted 38 minutes (Anglo-Zanzibar War).
You’re more likely to be killed by a vending machine than a shark.
